business.headline: India tightens insurance rules. Will insurers settle claims better?The new insurance laws significantly strengthen regulatory oversight and enforcement across the sector. In this special report, IndiaToday.in examines whether that will translate into faster, fairer claims for policyholders.
Silver slips after hitting record high of Rs 2.04 lakh/kg in Delhi, gold flatSpot silver was trading 0.56 per cent higher at USD 65.85 per ounce in the overseas trade.

From ports to airports: What pushed Adani Group into aviationJeet Adani, Gautam Adani's younger son and a director at Adani Airports, said the experience gained in ports and logistics helped the group enter aviation with confidence.

Why Jeet Adani says resilience is the next big challenge for Indian aviationWhile speaking to India Today, Adani said that aviation is a fragile system in which even small issues can quickly escalate into major problems.

Navi Mumbai airport will be one of most sustainable airports in world: Jeet AdaniSpeaking in the 'Jab We Met' segment, Jeet Adani said development and ecology should not be viewed as opposing ideas. He said large infrastructure projects must grow in a way that protects natural systems, as this also helps safeguard long-term assets and operations.
Built for the future: Jeet Adani on how Navi Mumbai Airport changes Mumbai aviationJeet Adani said the new airport will unlock long-term growth and improve global connectivity for the city.

Avadhut Sathe gets interim relief as SAT defreezes accounts for expensesIn August, Sebi conducted a search-and-seizure operation at Avadhut Sathe's Karjat Trading Academy as part of a broader crackdown on financial influencers offering market advice without proper registration.
Sensex ends 447 points higher, Nifty above 25,900; RIL up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex added 447.55 points to close at 84,929.36, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 150.85 points to end at 25,966.40.

Got an SMS or email from the Income Tax Department? Here's what it meansGot an unexpected SMS or email from the Income Tax Department about your transactions and unsure what to do next? The department has clarified the purpose behind these alerts.

Adani Group to bid for 11 airports amid India's air travel boom: ReportThe Indian government has been leasing out government-owned airports on long-term contracts to private companies. At the same time, it is encouraging the construction of new airports to improve connectivity across the country.

8th Pay Commission update: How big could be the salary hike and what to expectHere's what central government employees can realistically expect from the 8th Pay Commission now that the 7th CPC's term ends in December 2025 and when the cash might actually hit bank accounts.

ICICI Prudential AMC makes strong debut: What long, short-term investors should doICICI Prudential AMC share price: The listing was slightly below grey market expectations. Ahead of the debut, the IPO was commanding a grey market premium of Rs 520–530, which had indicated possible listing gains of around 24%.

ICICI Prudential AMC shares list at 20% premium: Hold or sell?Shares of ICICI Prudential AMC debuted at Rs 2,606.20 on the BSE, marking a premium of 20.38% over the IPO issue price of Rs 2,165. On the NSE, the stock opened at around Rs 2,600, up 20.09%.
Sensex jumps 500 points: 3 reasons why stock market is rising today?At around 9:45 am, the S&P BSE Sensex jumped 525.11 points to 85,006.92, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 147.50 points to 25,963.30.

Ola Electric shares fall over 60% this year: What should investors do?The stock has now fallen nearly 63% in calendar year 2025, making it one of the worst-performing newly listed technology stocks this year. Ola Electric shares hit a fresh 52-week low of Rs 31.54 on Thursday.

Japan's central bank raises rates to 0.75%, highest in 30 yearsThe Bank of Japan raised its short-term policy rate to 0.75% from 0.5%, its first rate hike since January. In a statement, the Bank of Japan said that even after the hike, financial conditions would remain supportive for the economy

How aluminium is changing the job story in India's mineral-rich statesIndustry estimates cited by the Aluminium Association of India show that the sector has already generated over eight lakh jobs and supports 4,000 SMEs in its downstream ecosystem.
Sensex opens 300 points higher, Nifty above 25,900; Infosys up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 525.11 points to 85,006.92, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 147.50 points to 25,963.30 as of 9:45 am.

ICICI Prudential AMC IPO listing today: Is GMP pointing to gains for investors?The ICICI Prudential AMC IPO saw very strong demand during its three-day bidding period. The issue was subscribed 39.17 times overall.

Your SIP stayed at Rs 5,000 over the years. How not increasing it 10% cost you lakhsYour salary rose, expenses changed, but your SIP remained at Rs 5,000. Over time, this small choice can quietly cost you several lakhs in missed wealth. Let's understand how.

entertainment.headline: Korean couple Kim Woo-bin, Shin Min-a marry in Seoul after 10 years. First pic out Korean actors Kim Woo-bin and Shin Min-a got married at a private event in Seoul. Their agency shared the first picture from the intimate wedding.

Limbachiya and sons: Bharti-Haarsh announce arrival of baby boy in new video Comedian Bharti Singh and writer-husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa announced the arrival of their baby boy with a video on Saturday. This came following Bharti's hospitalisation due to a medical emergency.

Carries a masculine spine: Sandeep Vanga calls Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar powerful Director Sandeep Reddy Vanga shared his thoughts on Aditya Dhar's 'Dhurandhar', commending Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna's performances. The Bollywood action film has received notable attention for its depiction of violence and the strength of its cast.

Raj Khosla and Mera Gaon Mera Desh: The forgotten hero and his epic cinema As part of our Retro Review series, we revisit Mera Gaon Mera Desh, the blueprint that inspired dacoit westerns in Hindi cinema. Like its director Raj Khosla, the film, unfortunately, was never celebrated.

Conan O'Brien stopped 911 call during Nick–Rob Reiner fight at party: Report Rob and Michele Reiner were found dead at their Los Angeles home hours after leaving a holiday party hosted by Conan O'Brien. As per the latest reports, there was a public dispute between Rob and his son Nick, and how Conan O'Brien helped in de-escalating the matter.

Aryan Khan wins Best Debut Director for Ba***ds: Like my father, I love awards Aryan Khan received the Best Debutant Director Of The Year award for his Netflix series 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood'. The recognition came alongside an acceptance speech in which Khan expressed gratitude to his team and family.

Dhurandhar box office Day 15: Ranveer's film crosses Rs 730 crore worldwide Ranveer Singh's latest release, Dhurandhar, continues to receive tremendous response from fans across the world. The film has surpassed Rs 730 crore globally and shows no signs of slowing down.

South box office 2025: Malayalam peaks, Tamil and Telugu struggle, Kannada falters South Indian cinema in 2025 showed clear divides with Malayalam films leading in content and Tamil industry facing challenges. The shift signals audiences favour quality storytelling, and star power alone no longer guarantees success.

Malayalam legend Sreenivasan dies at 69 after long illness Veteran actor Sreenivasan died at the age of 69, leaving behind a significant legacy in the Malayalam film industry. His work as an actor, writer, and filmmaker shaped the course of Malayalam cinema for nearly five decades.

It's going to be worse: Rakesh Bedi teases his role's darker turn in Dhurandhar 2 Rakesh Bedi shared insights on his character's development in the sequel to 'Dhurandhar' and highlighted the shift from comedic roles to a more complex portrayal. The espionage thriller continues to perform strongly at the box office.

Rehman Dakait, Abrar, Rukma: New-age villains are stealing spotlight from the hero Today's Indian cinema features villains with emotional depth and complexity. These characters challenge traditional hero roles, reshaping storytelling and audience engagement.

JungKook's Golden Exhibition in Mumbai to BTS' parent company HYBE launch in India | Bang Si-Hyuk​ K-pop in India is entering a new phase, and Mumbai is at the centre of it. Starting December 12, Jungkook of BTS opened his first-ever solo exhibition in India, drawing fans from across the country and marking the first official BTS-related on-ground activity here. Know more on this.

Nick Jonas sends love to Ranveer after actor reacts to his viral Dhurandhar dance Nick Jonas sent his love to Ranveer Sigh and his family after the Bollywood star recently reacted to the singer's viral 'Dhurandhar' video. The film released in theatres on December 5.

Dhurandhar's Rs 1,000-crore box office march, and the new Hindi cinema order Dhurandhar eyes the Rs 1,000 crore global club after nearing Rs 500 crore nett in India. What the film's historic run means for Hindi cinema, Ranveer Singh, and Bollywood's evolving box office rules.

Mrunal Thakur on balancing Hindi and Telugu cinema: I like pushing my boundaries Mrunal Thakur shared her perspective on balancing work between Hindi and Telugu cinema. While speaking to India Today, she emphasised her interest in taking on new challenges and expanding her horizons.

Agastya Nanda: Ikkis felt like my last chance to prove myself Agastya Nanda has said that his upcoming film 'Ikkis' felt like his last opportunity to prove himself, highlighting the significance of war-drama for him. 'Ikkis' also features late actor Dharmendra in a pivotal character.

Radhika Apte on seeking therapy, being dropped from a film over 3-4 kilos Radhika Apte spoke to India Today about losing a film role over just a few kilos — which pushed her to therapy. She highlighted the film industry's body image and weight issues.

Agastya Nanda on working with Dharmendra in Ikkis: He was always involved Agastya Nanda shared his experience of working with late actor Dharmendra in the upcoming war-drama 'Ikkis' (2026). The actor spoke to India Today, about sharing screen-space with Dharmendra.

James Cameron addresses Matt Damon's claim on turning down Avatar profit share James Cameron has responded to Matt Damon's claim about turning down a 10 percent share of 'Avatar', disputing the actor's widely circulated claim and clarifying his perspective on the matter.

general news.headline: Shubman Gill dropped, Ishan Kishan picked as BCCI announces T20 World Cup squad Live Updates Shubman Gill has been dropped as India named Axar Patel as their vice-captain for the T20 World Cup to be co-hosted by India and Sri Lanka next year. Ishan Kishan has also been recalled after his heroics in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy final.

Air India Express pilot grounded after flier alleges assault at Delhi airportAir India Express has removed the accused pilot from official duties with immediate effect, pending an internal inquiry into the alleged assault incident that took place at Terminal 1 of Delhi Airport.

8 elephants killed as Rajdhani Express hits herd in Assam, 5 coaches derailFollowing the incident, senior railway officers, including the General Manager of Northeast Frontier Railway and the Divisional Railway Manager of Lumding, rushed to the site. Under their supervision, the passengers of the affected berths were temporarily accommodated in the vacant berths available in other coaches.

How empires, elites & Europeans enshrined an exogenous entityDravida began life as a Sanskritic whisper — yet by the first millennium CE, Tamilakam's saints, scholars, sovereigns and subjects had turned it into a roar. Rajas and Prajas alike gave the word currency, credibility and even a circular halo. Tamil ploughed its lone, luminous furrow, but Dravida lingered like an uninvited uncle who refused to leave the public wedding feast.

Dhurandhar's Rs 1,000-crore box office march, and the new Hindi cinema orderDhurandhar eyes the Rs 1,000 crore global club after nearing Rs 500 crore nett in India. What the film's historic run means for Hindi cinema, Ranveer Singh, and Bollywood's evolving box office rules.

Bharat Taxi will run like Amul does, what is this cooperative modelBharat Taxi is attempting to become the "Amul of ride-hailing" by returning power to the drivers taking on the heavyweights like Uber, Ola, and Rapido. By adopting a zero-commission, member-owned model, Bharat Taxi promises to transform the gig economy from a profit-seeking corporate engine into a sustainable, driver-centric cooperative. India Today Tech takes a closer look.

This private factory wants to make one new space rocket every monthThis immersive story follows a full day spent inside the high-security facility where engineers, technicians, and scientists are racing against time to prepare Vikram-I, the startup's first orbital launch vehicle, for its upcoming space mission.

Live: What action is Yunus govt taking? Shashi Tharoor on Hindu man's lynchingBangladesh Protests Live Updates: Bangladesh will hold the funeral of the radical, anti-India youth leader Sharif Osman Hadi today under heightened security after his death sparked unrest across the country. The interim government said the funeral prayer will take place at the South Plaza of the National Parliament Building at 2 pm. Authorities also announced there will be no public viewing of the body and appealed to people to offer prayers while maintaining order. The body arrived in Dhaka from Singapore on Friday, following which the interim government urged citizens to resist violence by what it described as "fringe elements". In a late Thursday televised address, Chief Adviser Muhammad Yunus promised swift justice in the killing, asserting that "no leniency will be shown" to those responsible. Despite the appeal, several areas witnessed attacks and vandalism on Thursday night, including stone-pelting at the residence of the Assistant Indian High Commissioner in Chattogram, shortly after Yunus confirmed Hadi's death. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

After Bihar, need to get rid of jungle raj from Bengal: PM jabs TrinamoolAddressing people through a virtual rally from Kolkata Airport, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that the people of Bengal will put an end to the alleged misrule of the Mamata Banerjee government in the state.

Why was Gill axed from T20 World Cup squad? Selector Ajit Agarkar explainsIndia's T20 World Cup 2026 squad announcement delivered a major surprise with Shubman Gill left out of the 15-member squad. However, the chief selector clarified that the decision was not a reflection of Gill's calibre.

7 arrested over Hindu man's lynching in Bangladesh, says Yunus governmentThe action came two days after a mob accused Dipu Das, a Hindu man hailing from Mymensingh, of making derogatory remarks on the Prophet Muhammad and beat him to death.

150 computers stolen, food looted: How mob vandalised Bangladesh media housesViolent mobs in Dhaka launched coordinated attacks on major newspapers The Daily Star and Prothom Alo following the death of a political activist, causing severe damage and disrupting publication.

In pics: India's first nature-themed airport terminal to be unveiled in GuwahatiThe new airport terminal of the Gopinath Bordoloi International will be inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday afternoon. The terminal is built at a cost of Rs 4,000 crore.

When breakup triggers wedding bells: The hidden truth behind rebound marriagesAfter a breakup, the pain can make marriage feel like the answer. But sometimes, it isn't love, it's just your emotions playing tricks on you.

PM Modi's chopper fails to land in Bengal district due to fog, returns to KolkataPM Modi had arrived in Kolkata around 10.40 am and was scheduled to launch highway projects in Nadia district before addressing the BJP's Parivartan Sankalpa Sabha later in the day.

Pak court sentences Imran Khan, his wife to 17 years in jail in corruption caseThe verdict added to Imran Khan's mounting legal troubles, with the former Prime Minister remaining behind bars at Rawalpindi's Adiala jail since August 2023 in corruption and anti-terrorism cases.

Why H-1B is being used to hire teachers in USNot just techies, teachers too are hired in the US through the H-1B programme. This came into focus as the California Department of Education said its school districts filed more than 300 H-1B visa applications for 2023–24, double the number from two years earlier. The US faces a critical shortage of school teachers, and the high fees on new H-1B visas might add to the crisis. States like California have sued the Trump administration.

Selector Ajit Agarkar explains India's T20 World Cup 2026 squad announcement delivered a major surprise with Shubman Gill left out of the 15-member squad. However, the chief selector clarified that the decision was not a reflection of Gill's calibre.

Ishan Kishan has also been recalled after his heroics in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy final.

Australia leave England on the mat in Adelaide Test, edge closer to retaining Ashes Ashes: Australia are just four wickets away from winning the third Test at the Adelaide Oval and retaining the urn. England still need 228 runs with only four wickets in hand, and will have to produce something extraordinary to avoid defeat.

Kavem Hodge leads West Indies' strong fightback with classy hundred on Day 3 Kavem Hodge led a determined West Indies fightback on day three, reaching his second Test hundred as the visitors closed at 381 for 6, still 194 runs behind New Zealand's first-innings total.

Mohammed Shami to lead Bengal's pace attack in Vijay Hazare Trophy Experienced pacer Mohammed Shami has been named in Bengal's squad for the Vijay Hazare Trophy following a strong domestic season. Shami, who has not featured for India recently, brings his impressive form to Bengal's campaign as the team prepares to compete in Elite Group B.

Anthony Joshua hands boxing reality check to Jake Paul with a 6th round KO Anthony Joshua delivered a brutal reminder of boxing's pecking order by stopping Jake Paul in Miami. The sixth-round knockout exposed the gap between elite heavyweight pedigree and crossover hype.

Shubman Gill should continue to open, Sanju Samson can bat at no 3: Uthappa Former India cricketer Robin Uthappa has backed Shubman Gill to continue as India's T20I opener despite poor form. He suggests Sanju Samson should bat at No 3 to strengthen the lineup ahead of the T20 World Cup.

Suryakumar needs just one good innings to reaffirm T20I calibre: Tilak Suryakumar Yadav's prolonged lean patch has become India's lone T20 concern before a home World Cup. Teammate Tilak Varma believes one defining innings is enough to restore the skipper's fear factor.

IPL auction: What happened to the uncapped crorepatis of the past? IPL auction: Before the Chennai Super Kings splurged Rs 14.2 crore each on Prashant Veer and Kartik Sharma, the IPL had seen several uncapped crorepatis. Here's where those bets led.

T20 World Cup squad live: Shubman Gill snub a real surprise, says Sunil Gavaskar Team India Squad Announcement Live Updates: The BCCI have taken some massive calls here considering they dropped Shubman Gill from the side for the T20 World Cup with Axar Patel taking over as the vice-captain of the side.

Not Bumrah, Pandya was the difference between two teams: South Africa coach South Africa head coach Shukri Conrad has showered praise on Hardik Pandya following his terrific all-round performance in the T20I series. Pandya was adjudged Player of the Match following his breathtaking innings of 63 (25).

When Hardik Pandya lit up Ahmedabad with Sir Viv-esque swaggerHardik Pandya's swagger-lit masterclass against South Africa had echoes of Sir Vivian Richards, according to Robin Uthappa. The former India batter believes such intimidation-driven cricket defines India's ideal T20 template going forward.

Mohamed Salah is his own man, apologised to Liverpool dressing room: Teammate revealsCurtis Jones revealed Mohamed Salah apologised to Liverpool teammates after controversy. The midfielder said the dressing room stayed united, insisting Salah's comments reflected elite competitiveness rather than any intent to destabilise Arne Slot's squad.

Rohit Sharma set to miss first few Vijay Hazare Trophy matches. Here's whyRohit Sharma will miss Mumbai's opening Vijay Hazare Trophy matches as selectors prioritise testing emerging talent this season. The call has dampened fan excitement, especially with senior stars returning to domestic cricket spotlight nationwide anticipation.

Gill out, firepower In: Why India must unleash Sanjushek in T20IsThe Indian team found their attacking mojo once again and it was no surprise that reinstallation of Sanju Samson and Abhishek Sharma at the top led to the change. While Shubman Gill remains a fine player, India needs to replace finesse with firepower if they want to retain their T20 World Cup crown.

India to announce T20 World Cup squad today. Will selectors back out-of-form Shubman Gill?Shubman Gill's role in the squad will be the main focus as India will announce their side for the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026 on Saturday, December 20. With the team also mos well-set, will the selectors throw a few curveballs at the fans with some bold choices?

Watch: Hardik applies ice pack to cameraman hit by his six in Ahmedabad T20IIndia vs South Africa: One of Hardik Pandya's five monstrous sixes struck a cameraman at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on Friday. The all-rounder went over to check on him immediately after the final delivery of the match was bowled.

Surya, the batter, is missing: Captain's frank take on eve of T20 World Cup selectionIndia captain Suryakumar Yadav delivered a blunt verdict on his own form after the South Africa series. The Indian skipper said that he went missing in action as a batter for the side during the series win against the Proteas.

When Hardik Pandya kept promise to girlfriend during the Ahmedabad blitzIND vs SA, 5th T20I: Hardik Pandya kept a promise to his girlfriend by attacking the very first ball and delivering a spectacular 63, powering India to a 3-1 T20I series victory over South Africa in Ahmedabad.

5th T20I: Gill-less India flaunt all-round might, end 2025 with series victoryIND vs SA, 5th T20I: Tilak Varma and Hardik Pandya struck commanding half-centuries, while spinner Varun Chakravarthy claimed four wickets as India defeated South Africa by 30 runs on Saturday to clinch the five-match T20I series 3-1.

It's official. Virat Kohli will play domestic one-dayers for DelhiVirat Kohli is expected to play a couple of Vijay Hazare Trophy matches for Delhi. The Delhi state body named a 16-man squad and added Kohli, Rishabh Pant, Ishant Sharma, Harshit Rana and Navdeep Saini additionally.

ISL clubs propose club-owned league model, AIFF to be regulatorIndian Super League clubs on Friday proposed a major overhaul of the country's top-tier football league, seeking perpetual operational and commercial rights under a club-owned model, with the AIFF continuing as the regulator.

Hardik blows kisses to Mahieka Sharma after record T20I fifty in AhmedabadHardik Pandya scored a sensational fifty and sent kisses to his girlfriend Mahieka Sharma after thrilling the Ahmedabad crowd during the final match of the series against South Africa on Friday, December 19.

Suryakumar dejected after another failure, ends 2025 without a single T20I fiftyIndia vs South Africa: Suryakumar Yadav cut a dejected figure after another failure with the bat in the fifth T20I, as the India captain ended 2025 without a single T20I fifty and continued his prolonged batting slump.

Amorim breaks silence on bombshell Fernandes interview, 'free Mainoo' shirtManchester United manager Ruben Amorim has broken his silence on Bruno Fernandes' comments and the controversy surrounding Kobbie Mainoo's brother wearing a 'Free Kobbie Mainoo' T-shirt ahead of the Premier League clash against Aston Villa.

Ahmedabad T20I: Abhishek misses out on Kohli's all-time record by a whiskerAbhishek Sharma missed Virat Kohli's all-time T20 record for India by a whisker as his incredible 2025 came to an end in Ahmedabad. Abhishek scored 34 off 20 balls and missed Kohli's record by 12 runs.

After dream RCB deal, Vihaan Malhotra stuns with 35-ball fifty in U19 Asia Cup semisVihaan Malhotra starred with a 35-ball fifty against Sri Lanka to guide India into the U19 Asia Cup 2025 final, just days after securing his first IPL contract with Royal Challengers Bengaluru.

Why is Sanju not there? Ravi Shastri makes explosive Samson vs Gill comment on airFormer India head coach Ravi Shastri made explosive remarks on air comparing Sanju Samson and Shubman Gill as T20I openers after Samson grabbed his opportunity with both hands, producing a blistering powerplay display when he stepped in for the injured Gill in the fifth T20I against South Africa.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
